IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: Eaglebrook is a school for boys in the 6th, 7th, 8th, and 9th grades. In a warm, caring, structured atmosphere boys learn more than they ever thought possible, discover inner resources, develop self-confidence, and have fun along the way. Eaglebrook welcomes boys of any race, color, nationality, sexual orientation religion, and all share the same privileges and duties.Eaglebrook's role is to help each boy come in to full and confident possession of his innate talents, to improve the skills needed for the challenges of secondary school, and to establish values that will allow him to be a person who respects individual differences and acts with thoughtfulness and humanity.At the heart of the school is the shared life of teachers, their families, and boys working together. Teachers make learning an adventure and watch over each boy's personal growth. They set the academic tone, coach the teams, serve as dormitory parents, and are available for a boy when he needs a friend.

In a warm, caring, structured atmosphere boys learn more than they ever thought possible, discover inner resources, develop self-confidence, and have fun along the way. IRS990.Desc: The delivery of a quality education and the promotion of physical education to approximately 246 boarding and day students and 70 summer session students in grades 6 - 9.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL'S ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE INVESTED FOR LONG-TERM GROWTH IN ORDER TO PROVIDE A RATE OF RETURN WHICH, SUBJECT TO THE SCHOOL'S SPENDING POLICY, WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT THE SCHOOL'S CURRENT AND FUTURE PROGRAMS.

The School's Federal information returns prior to fiscal year 2013 are closed and management continually evaluates expiring statutes of limitations, audits, proposed settlements, changes in tax law and new authoritative rulings. If the School had unrelated business income taxes, it would recognize interest and penalties associated with any tax matters as part of the income tax provision and include accrued interest and penalties with the related tax liability in the statements of financial position.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FINANCIAL AID IS AWARDED THROUGH A PROCESS WHICH BEGINS WITH THE PARENTS' SUBMISSION OF AN APPLICATION TO SCHOOL AND STUDENT SERVICES (SSS). RESULTING INFORMATION IS THEN REVIEWED BY THE SCHOOL'S FINANCIAL AID COMMITTEE, WHICH IS CHARGED WITH FINAL DISTRIBUTION OF APPROVED FINANCIAL AID AWARDS.

FOR THE BENEFIT AND CONVENIENCE OF THE SCHOOL AND AS A CONDITION OF THEIR EMPLOYMENT, CERTAIN EMPLOYEES ARE PROVIDED WITH ON-CAMPUS RESIDENCES AT THE SCHOOL'S EXPENSE. FOR THE CONVENIENCE OF THE SCHOOL, THESE RESIDENCES ARE READILY AVAILABLE AND USED FOR SCHOOL-RELATED ORDINARY AND NECESSARY BUSINESS FUNCTIONS ON A REGULAR AND CONTINUING BASIS.
Officers received a discretionary bonus payment, which was approved by the executive committee of the board of trustees and headmaster.

TaxExemptBondsIssuesGrp.PurposeDesc: redemption of series 2007 bonds, construction and related costs

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DURING THE TAX YEAR, THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES INCLUDED SIX INDIVIDUALS CONSTITUTING 3 MARRIED COUPLES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: UPON ITS COMPLETION, THE FORM 990 IS REVIEWED IN DETAIL BY MANAGEMENT. ONCE APPROVED BY MANAGEMENT, THE FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO THE AUDIT COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES FOR ITS REVIEW AND APPROVAL. UPON APPROVAL BY THE AUDIT COMMITTEE, THE FORM 990, IS PROVIDED TO THE BOARD OF TRUSTEE, PRIOR TO FILING. IN ORDER TO PRESERVE THE PRIVACY OF ITS DONOR BASE, THE FORM 990 DISTRIBUTED TO THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES EXCLUDES SCHEDULE B.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The School's Business Office collects and reviews all annual acknowledgements completed by the Trustees. any potential conflicts are forwarded and addressed by the headmaster and/or the Board chair, as deemed appropriate.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXCECUTIVE COMMITTEE DETERMINES COMPENSATION FOR THE HEADMASTER AND OTHER OFFICERS BY COMPILING AND REVIEWING COMPARABLE DATA FOR SIMILAR DUTIES FROM PEER INSTITUTIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: the school makes its governing documents, conflict of interest policies and financial statements available for public inspection upon request at its administrative offices in deerfield, ma.
